title: Contemporary body copy font
content:
I'm desperately trying to find a decent body copy font – a nice contemporary one with the feel of 'lineto' or something about it. I found Babbage on Veer but I'm worried how well it would work as body copy at 8pt. I definitely don't want to be using Times or something along those 'traditional serif' lines but I need this font to fit into a fairly tight space as far as magazine page sizes are concerned.

Any help would be appreciated!
author: geeedeee

comments.content:
You ask a great question. I'd be tempted to recommend any of the Martin Majoor faces - perhaps Seria? ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/seria-sans/familytree.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120122122438/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/seria-sans/familytree.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/seria-sans/familytree.html"))

Also, Neutraface is getting a lot of play lately, but I'd guess you want more x-height...

There's always Filosofia ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/filosofia/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120122122438/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/filosofia/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/filosofia/")) and Eidetic Neo ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/eidetic-neo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120122122438/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/eidetic-neo/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/eidetic-neo/")).

Hope this helps, and I'm eager to see what other folks suggest.

I assume you want a serif font.

FF Quadraat perhaps? Apolline comes to mind. I know that Adobe's WarnockPro is well-liked. Proforma from Font Bureau might serve you well. FF Avance is a quality face.

Have a look at some of those.

Good question, though.
